results.title: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

video_links.name: Sue Smith and John Alsop : Screen Worlds Spotlight interview

results.brief_description: An interview with screenwriters Sue Smith and John Alsop for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Sue Smith and John Alsop are screenwriters and playwrights who have collaborated on productions such as “My Brother Jack”, “Brides of Christ”, “Bordertown” and “The Leaving of Liverpool”.

results.title: Castlemaine artists
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Castlemaine boasts a thriving art scene from emerging to established artists. This film introduces us to some of these artists; including mosaic artists, musicians, painters, and printmakers; and takes us through the creative spaces in which they work. They discuss how their immediate environment has influenced their art and how the many artistic hubs become vibrant gathering spaces for the community.
results.description: Castlemaine boasts a thriving art scene from emerging to established artists. This film introduces us to some of these artists; including mosaic artists, musicians, painters, and printmakers; and takes us through the creative spaces in which they work. They discuss how their immediate environment has influenced their art and how the many artistic hubs become vibrant gathering spaces for the community.

results.title: My Omeo: A Short History
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jeff Cooper is a guardian of all things great about Omeo and its chequered history. His role within the community is not only as a custodian of the local records but also as a passionate tour guide of the Omeo Historic Park and local gold fields. The Park contains 5 heritage-listed buildings that are believed to be some of the most intact and original in Australia. Jeff believes Omeo is the last bastion of self-funded retirement and despite losing his home and livestock in the 2003 bushfires, wouldn’t live anywhere else in the world.
results.description: Jeff Cooper is a guardian of all things great about Omeo and its chequered history. His role within the community is not only as a custodian of the local records but also as a passionate tour guide of the Omeo Historic Park and local gold fields. Jeff believes Omeo is the last bastion of self-funded retirement and despite losing his home and livestock in the 2003 bushfires, wouldn’t live anywhere else in the world.

Jeff believes Omeo is the last bastion of self-funded retirement and despite losing his home and livestock in the 2003 bushfires, wouldn’t live anywhere else in the world.

results.title: A Journey to a new land
results.creator_credit: Tuan Anh Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leaving family and escaping from Vietnam in 1978 and eventually arriving in Australia by boat as a refugee, it would be six years before Tuan Anh Tran could finally be reunited with his family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tuan Anh Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
